课程教师信息

英语C

课程编码：15MGB003H 英文名称：Specialized English 课时：36 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
本课程是为专业学位研究生开设的专业英语课程。专业学位英语研究生在完成基础英语的学习以后，进入专业英语的学习。重点解决学术交流活动中说和写的问题。说的方面，主要培养学生在参加国际学术会议时作口头报告和讨论的口语表达能力，内容涉及语音，口头报告的一般性结构、常用表达方式，口头报告的仪态，就学术问题进行提问和回答的技巧等；写的方面，主要通过系统的训练，使学生能够用英语撰写符合规范的学术论文，特别是英文摘要、引言以及总结的写法。

预修课程

教材
一． Practical Writing 高教出版社
二． 国际学术交流口语 清华大学出版社
三． 自编.

主要内容
1．熟悉和国际交流有关的活动的流程和惯例，并掌握相关的英语表达方式。
2．培养学生参加一般性专业领域的讨论能力。
3．培养学生作口头英语报告的能力。
4. 介绍书面学术文体的一般性特点。
5. 训练书写英文摘要等文体。

课程教师信息

学术交流英语口语-01班

课程编码：15MGX003H-01 英文名称：Spoken English for Academic Activities 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：刘彬

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共选修课。学生应该在硕士学习期间继续提高听、说、读、写、译各个方面的能力，但随着近年来各高校和研究单位的国际合作和交流不断增多，迫切要求学生在此阶段就具备一定的国际性学术交流能力，特别是口语表达能力，如接待外宾，主持国际会议，宣讲论文和参加讨论会等。学生们自己也要走出去，或参加国际会议，或出国深造。因此，他们对这方面的需求也很迫切。通过本门课程的学习，学生应该能够在这类情况下基本应付可能遇到的学术交流任务，掌握这些活动的一般程序和所需的特殊语言技能。

预修课程

教材
一． Presenting in English, by Mark Powell, LTP business, 1996.
二． 《学术交流英语》 王惠莉，高等教育出版社，2006.9

主要内容
1．进一步打好一般性口语基础。
2．熟悉和国际交流有关的活动的流程和惯例，并掌握相关的英语表达方式。
3．培养学生参加一般性专业领域的讨论能力。
4．培养学生作口头英语报告的能力。

英文名称: English Listening Course for International Communication
详细内容:
国际交流英语听力-01班

课程编码：15MGX005H-01 英文名称：English Listening Course for International Communication 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：彭工

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科、各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设的公共选修课。
在语言学习的进程中，听说读写四个技能不可或缺，尤其听的能力尤为重要。学生由于语言环境匮乏，基础不够扎实，在国际合作和交流中听力水平造成的问题比较突出。因此，该课程设置旨在满足学生提高英语听力水平的迫切需求。通过学习，学生应该在听懂国外会议的报告、用英语进行学术交流和日常交流等方面有较大提高。
此外，根据中国目前经济发展状况来看，政府机构和中外企业急需大量具备国际交流能力的人才，该课程也为学生参加符合国际标准的外语资格认定考试（托业考试）提供一些相关练习，提高学生在职场上使用英语交流的能力。

预修课程

教材
国际交流视听说第四册

主要内容
1. 提高日常英语交流能力。
2. 提高工作场景中运用英语的交流能力。
3. 提高在国际学术会议、报告中的使用英语的交流能力等。

高级语音训练-01班

课程编码：15MGX007H-01 英文名称：Advanced Pronunciation Training 课时：32 学分：1.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：刘彬

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院招收的各学科，各专业攻读硕士学位的研究生开设公共选修课。在我们英语A和英语B的教学过程中，我们发现在学生的口头表达中存在着很多的问题，其中基础发音还相当薄弱，以至于一些同学的英语根本无法听懂，更不用说用流畅、优美的英语表达思想了。因此本课程旨在纠正不良的发音习惯，为学生今后能练就标准，流畅的英语口语打下良好的语音基础。通过教授和练习，使学生对基础发音以及和发音相关的语音技巧有一个全面的了解和掌握。

预修课程

教材
1 Well Said. Advanced English Pronunciation by Linda Grant.(with four cassette tapes)
2. Fast Speech English. (Listening Tapes) by Longman Corporation Lt.
3. Listening in the real world.
4. Presenting in English by Mark Powell, LTP Business

主要内容
第一章 建立学生发音错误档案：每个学生从课程的第一单元建立一份档案，记录他们在音素，单词和语句等各层次上的错误和不到位的问题。本档案也作为考核内容的一项依据。
第二章 借助教材，录音材料对英语的辅音，元音音素的准确音质通过单词，短语和句子进行分析，对比，模仿和操练，直到准确为止。
第三章 对连读，同化，除阻，弱读，重音等加以训练。
第四章 语调的训练包括句子重点的突出和节奏的把握，并需结合上述技巧的使用。

参考文献

德语（二外）

课程编码：15MGX012H 英文名称：German 课时：90 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：沈永前

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院已通过硕士学位英语资格考试的各学科、各专业硕士、博士研究生开设的公共选修课。通过本课程学习，要求学生掌握基本语法和1000个常用单词，并能够借助字典阅读一般德语文章。

预修课程

教材
殷桐生等，《德语300小时》(修订版)，外语教学与研究出版社，2004年3月。

主要内容
1. 德语字母的正确发音及拼读规则；
2. 名词、冠词、代词及形容词的变格及用法、常用介词的基本用法；
3. 德语六种时态的构成、被动态的构成及用法；
4. 基本句型、并列复合句、常用主从复合句；
5. 形容词及副词的比较级和最高级的构成及基本用法；
6. 不定式及分词的基本用法；
7. 虚拟式的构成及基本用法。

参考文献
《德语语法练习》，中国科学院研究生院讲义，2004年9月

课程教师信息

课程编码：15MGX013H-01 英文名称：Japanese 课时：60 学分：2.00 课程属性：公共选修课 主讲教师：马潇漪

教学目的要求
本课程是为我院各学科、各专业硕士、博士研究生(初学者)开设的公共选修课。通过本课程学习，要求学生掌握基本语法和1000个左右单词，能够借助有关工具书阅读简单的日文资料。

预修课程

教材
北京大学东语系日语教研室《日语》. 商务印书馆，北京，1998。
《一起来听日语吧》(听力) 选自《新日语基础教程》、《唱歌学日语》。

主要内容
1. 语音：清音，浊音，半浊音，长音，促音，拨音，拗音.
2. 语法：判断句，存在句，描写句，叙述句.
用言变化：动词，形容词，形容动词..
3. 助词：格助词，副助词.接续助词.提示助词.并列助词.,终助词等.
4. 助动词：否定.敬语.推量,判断助动词等.
5． 其它：补助动词，形式体言，形式用言，惯用型等。

课程编码：161MX004Z 英文名称：Integrated Water Management and Legislation 课时：200 学分：8.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：崔骁勇等

教学目的要求
The objectives of the module are to:
train the students be skilled in how external nutrient reduction affects streams, lakes and reservoirs in different climate zones
provide a basic understanding of physico-chemical and biological restoration methods for streams and lakes/reservoirs
understand basic concepts of crop water relations, water productivity and strategies for efficient water and nutrients (mainly N and P) management in agro-ecosystems
provide an overview and understanding of water legislation, policy and planning in China and the EU
provide a basic understanding of urban water systems, and how nature-based approaches to current freshwater challenges may contribute to climate resilience and sustainable urban development.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
Management
Water dynamics in the soil-plant-atmosphere continuum (SPAC)
Water balance in the field, crop water productivity and irrigation strategies
Plant nutrition functions, plant nutrient deficiency diagnosis
Soil fertility concepts, turnover of N and P in soil and effect on plant nutrient availability
Fertilization strategies and farming systems, methods to improve nutrient use efficiency, reduce N and P losses, improve crop yield and quality
Modelling water, N and P dynamics in the soil-plant systems and losses to the environment
Water Legislation and Policy
 General introduction to water legislation in China and the EU
The challenge of sustainable management – why do we need to regulate the use of resources?
The institutional set-up and main pieces of water legislation in China as part of the evolving national water policy with a particular view to water quality.
SDC MSc in Water and Environment 2015/2016 Fulai Liu
Module 4: Integrated Water Management and Legislation
Page 4
The institutional set-up in the EU and the main elements of EU water policy and legislation with a particular focus on the EU Water Framework Directive and integrated water resource management.
Water policy and implementation
Policy instruments in general: Command-and-control-regulation, economic instruments, information/voluntary instruments. Pros and cons.
Implementation. Potential difficulties in fulfilling policy aims; potential obstacles during the implementation process – for instance at target group level and organizational level?
Water policy instruments– lessons from Europe. Primary focus will be on European experiences with economic policy instruments in water (currently analyzed in a European Union research project called ‘EPI Water’).
Evaluation of environmental policies.
Water planning
Spatial planning principles and water management
Top-down and bottom-up approaches in water management
Management challenges in common-pool resources (such as water)
Comprehensive cross-sectorial planning - policy integration in relation to water management
Urban Water Management
General introduction of urban water systems, challenges and trends in solutions, including water supply and treatment systems, urban drainage and conventional stormwater management
Stormwater quantity conveyance, detention and retention; stormwater quality, control and re-use options
Ecosystem services; non-conventional stormwater management; aquatic ecological restoration in inland urban lakes
General introduction on what a city is, urban development and how to manage transitions towards sustainable development

教学目的要求
Basic MRI covers the basic principles of magnetic resonance (MR) imaging and its use in research. This includes spin dynamics in a magnetic field, interaction of magnetization by radiofrequency pulses, principles of MR imaging using magnetic field gradients, relaxation of magnetization and contrast in images. The most important applications of MR will be introduced. These include angiography and blood flow measurement, perfusion and diffusion assessment and functional MRI. Besides, examples of the clinical use of MR imaging will be given.

教学目的要求
The aim of this course is to introduce pattern recognition and predictive modelling techniques and enable students to statistically analyze complex data sets as typically encountered in neuroscience. The course introduces topics in unsupervised and supervised learning beginning with presentations of unsupervised learning techniques such as k-means cluster analysis mixture models, as well as dimension reduction techniques. Within supervised learning, In addition, PRPM covers basic and advanced regression models for continuous and binary outcomes including penalized regression and support vector machines. The course emphasizes techniques for model training and assessment as well as variable selection.

Knowledge

- Understand mathematical and statistical principles in cluster analysis, Mixture models, Expectation maximization, Latent variable models, Dimension reduction, Regularized regression, Support Vector Machines, Classification, and Model assessment and selection

课程编码：162MX006Z 英文名称：Magnetoencephalography (MEG) and Electroenephalography (EEG) 课时：53 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：刘祖祥

教学目的要求
The synaptic signalling of the brain generates currents that in turn are associated with electric and magnetic fields strong enough to be recorded non-invasively on the surface of the human head. We begin the course with a close look at the fundamental biophysical properties of brain electrophysiological signals recorded by electro- (EEG) and/or magnetoencephalography (MEG), and draw attention to their complementarity with tomographic neuroimaging techniques. Considerable effort is made to understand the complex relationship between measured M/EEG signals and the spatial configuration of their generators in the brain. Such insight is not only key to correct interpretation of measurements, but also required for building a physiologically meaningful model that may be used to obtain estimates of cortical source locations. Signal detection itself, especially the multitude of possible sensor configurations, plays a critical role in determining how neuronal activity is reflected in the recordings. Hands-on laboratory exercises introduce students to the practical aspects of data collection, from preparation to acquisition and quality assurance. The event-related paradigm is the workhorse of M/EEG-based scientific inquiry, and is therefore used as an example of how brain function may be quantified using data analysis concepts and methods introduced during lectures and computer exercises. The aim of the course is to provide students with a solid foundation from which to develop a deeper understanding of the study of human brain electrophysiology using state-of-the-art techniques and experimental paradigms.

预修课程

教材
1. S. Luck, “An Introduction to the Event-Related Potential Technique”, 2nd Edition, The MIT Press, 2014.
• ISBN-13: 978-0262525855
• Detailed reading list will be provided during the course
2. Handouts (provided by the lecturers), containing published and original materials

主要内容
Knowledge
Successful completion of the course will enable the student to:
• Describe the biophysical model of the generators of the electric and magnetic fields that are measurable from outside the human head, and
• Characterize the coupling of EEG and MEG measurements to these fields, and the fundamental limitations on the signal information content imposed by physics
• Discuss method and parameter choices for obtaining spatially resolved estimates of current sources in the brain

参考文献
Skills
During the course the student will learn to:
• Identify artifactual M/EEG signal components and apply relevant signal processing tools for the mitigation of their effects on measures-of-interest
• Process M/EEG recordings and extract data features that address a physiologically or cognitively motivated question

Competencies
After the course the students can:
• Outline strategies for design, implementation, interpretation and adequate reporting of an event-related M/EEG experiment
• Reflect on ways to quantify experimental M/EEG data in order to reveal aspects of the underlying brain function
• Disseminate published literature and offer principled interpretation of results

课程编码：162MX007Z 英文名称：Neurotransmission, Neuropsychology, Psychiatry, and Neuropharmacology 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：华兆琳等

教学目的要求
This course builds upon the knowledge obtained in IN, MNN, and FCN with a focus on the communication between the cells of the brain and how this is studied using EEG & other neurophysiologic methods as well as PET, autoradiography and radiochemistry. Thus, several signaling systems of the brain will be introduced together with an account of the diseases of the brain caused by changes in these systems. Furthermore, the students will be given an introduction to common psychiatric disorders and the neuropharmacological treatment of these disorders such as affective disorders - unipolar (depression) and bipolar (manic-depressive); schizophrenia; anxiety disorders; OCD; eating- and personality disorders; psychiatric disorders in children; abuse and dependence disorders and pathological gambling.

Knowledge
The course will enable the student to understand and reflect on:

- How neuroanatomy affects mental functions
- How drug design builds on molecular engineering
Skills
During the course the student will acquire skills in:
- Basic features and applications of several important methodologies in neuroscience such as stereology, brain wave recording, transcranial magnetic stimulation, and advanced neuroimaging

整合神经影像学

课程编码：162MX008Z 英文名称：Integrative Neuroimaging 课时：48 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：王帆

教学目的要求
Neuroimaging techniques are capable of probing physiology and function at molecular, cellular and system levels, in animal models and humans. However, each imaging modality has
its unique strength and inherent limitations. Moreover, most imaging modalities are correlative in nature, precluding causal inferences. The aim of the Integrative Neuroimaging
Course is to give the students the possibility to gain experience in the rapidly advancing field of multimodal imaging. The students will learn about when, why, and how to combine different imaging modalities. The course will provide the students with a “multimodal imaging framework” which will help to critically interpret literature within the
field and to optimally plan scientific projects in the field of brain imaging. During the course the following topics will be covered in overview lectures or exercises:

• Introduction into the concepts behind integrative multimodal imaging.
• General analysis techniques useful for integration of modalities
• Integration of electrophysiology (EEG/ERP/MEG) and functional MRI
• Introdution to transcranial brain stimulation (TMS, TDCS) and deep brain stimulation
• Combining EEG and TMS/TDCS
• Neurostimulation and neuroimaging: TMS & fMRI, offline and online
• Integration of MR--‐related techniques: structural MRI (sMRI) and diffusion weighted MRI (DWI)
• Combining sMRI and functional MRI (fMRI)
• Combining DWI & fMRI
• Integrating DWI and TMS
• Integration of MR--‐based techniques with positron emission tomography

预修课程
Basic knowledge of the major brain mapping techniques (structural and functional MRI, diffusion sensitive MRI, PET, EEG, MEG) Basic experience with Matlab and MRI data analysis software

教材
Book: Oxford Handbook of Transcranial Stimulation 1st edition by Eric Wassermann, Charles Epstein, Ulf Ziemann (2008), Oxford University Press

主要内容
Knowledge
By the end of the course, the student will have
- Acquired indepth knowledge about how the combined use of brain mapping modalities can help overcome modality inherent weaknesses and to maximize the modality specific scientific potential
- Basic knowledge about how to model multimodal imaging data
- Knowledge on how to critically review own and published multimodal results
- The ability to understand, reflect over and explain how to best integrate two imaging modalities
- Acquired knowledge to be able to identify neuroscientific questions that can best be studied with an integrative neuroimaging approach

Skills The student will be able to:
- Design a multimodal neuroimaging study: Identify the most relevant neuroimaging techniques, choose the most appropriate analysis tools and discuss strengths and weaknesses of different approaches
- Explain how to incorporate interventional approaches (TMS, TDCS) in brain mapping studies
- Explain the technical and computational challenges of multimodal integration
- Co-register multimodal imaging data and integrate data sets acquired in different imaging modalities for subsequent analysis
- Evaluate the choice of method for multimodal integration
- Evaluate and choose the most appropriate neurostimulation techniques and protocols
- Account for solution strategy and analysis of results, as necessary for publication in scientific journals
- Disseminate knowledge about integrative neuroimaging and discuss related professional and scientific topics with both peers and non-specialists

Competencies
This course provides the students with the capacity to:
- Overview complex experimental situations that require the integration of two imaging modalities
- Plan and pursue interdisciplinary cooperation with researchers using complementary imaging modalities
- Develop new ideas on how to improve multimodal integration and implement novel applications for integrative neuroimaging
- Acquired knowledge to be able to identify neuroscientific questions that can best be studied with an integrative neuroimaging approach

课程编码：165MX005Z 英文名称：Process Design - Principles and Methods 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
Process design involves the solution of open-ended problems. The design problem is first defined and then broken
down into a set of sub-problems (tasks) that are solved in a specified sequence. In each task, a set of design decisions
are made, analyzed and verified. Therefore, the final process design and the path to achieve it depend on the design
decisions taken in each of the design tasks. This means that there could be many process designs for the defined design
problem. In this course, the process design problem solution is broken down into 12 design tasks, to be performed in a
specific sequence.

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
• Make design related decisions
• Use knowledge to solve practical engineering problems
• Analyse data
• Work in groups
• Use computer aided tools
• Generate and screen alternatives
• Verify and analyse simulation results
• Formulate process design problems and to develop systematic solution strategies
• Apply chemical engineering principles learned from other courses
• Apply “green” or environmental issues in process design

预修课程

教材
Lorenze T. Biegler, Ignacio E. Grossmann and Arthur W. Westerberg: Systematic Methods of Chemical Process Design, Prentice Hall, 1997.

主要内容
The course will be divided into two parts. The first part will deal with introduction to process design principles, the
stages of the process design life cycle and the preliminary design steps (flow sheet synthesis, equipment sizing/costing,
economic evaluation, scheduling of batch operations, distillation sequences, pinch analysis). The second part will
deal with conceptual design (advanced process synthesis (such as heat integration, heat exchanger networks, reactor
networks, reaction-separation sequences, solvent selection), equipment selection, flow sheet optimization).

The course aims at qualifying the students to combine previously acquired knowledge on chemical engineering with

A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:

and environmental impacts
• Describe and discuss the sensitivity of the climate system as well as of our society to GHG emissions from energy
conversion and use
• Plan strategic sustainable development of a region with special focus on energy supply and consumption using back
casting from sustainability principles
• Identify and discuss consequences of resource limitations for future energy technologies
• Discuss different criteria for sustainability of biofuels with focus on GHG emissions and energy consumption
• Explain the principles of life cycle assessments. Identify and discuss challenges in their application
• Perform and evaluate simple EROI calculations (energy return on energy investment) for different energy technologies
• Critically examine results from life cycle inventories to evaluate a number of different energy technologies including
those based on biomass

预修课程

教材
Compendium consisting mainly of published papers and book chapters

主要内容
The course aims at providing an understanding of general principles of sustainability and sustainable development in a
system perspective. Briefly we will introduce how the climate system works and how it responds to greenhouse gas (GHG)
emissions from fossil fuel emissions and land use change. We will discuss the implications of the interactions between
population, energy consumption, affluence and climate change for sustainable development. We deal specifically with
a number of renewable energy technologies with focus on bioenergy and evaluate them from a life cycle perspective
based on energy and material flows in specific socio-ecological contexts. We deal with the basic concepts of life cycle
assessments, e.g. system boundary, functional unit, co-products/by-products and normalization. Data sources and the
implications of uncertainty of the calculated indicators for the quality of the assessment will be discussed.

课程编码：166MX005Z 英文名称：Nanoelectronics 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：裘晓辉

教学目的要求
We aim at giving a phenomenological introduction to selected topics in the physics of nanostructures. The general theme is current flow (electron transport) in (low-dimensional) nanoscale structures, where quantum effects are expressed clearly. The basic formalism, key concepts and real experiments will be discussed, rather than complete theoretical treatments, which are covered in other courses. The students will be provided with the background for understanding a wealth of recent experiments in the field which ranges from quantum Hall physics, single-electron transport through “artificial atoms” in semiconductor structures to real “molecular transistors” based on single molecules. In addition to the purely scientific interest, these phenomena are also of technological importance in nanoelectronics and potential future applications in quantum information processing.

Electronic transport in nanostructures. The course will cover the following areas: concepts in electron transport, current flow in nanostructures, mesoscopic electron transport, the quantization of charge, and conductance and their consequences for transport, Landauer (transmission) formalism. The chosen examples will include quantum wires, low dimensional semiconductor structures, quantum dots, graphene, carbon nanotubes, molecular transistors, and other timely subjects in nanoelectronics. One session will be devoted to nano fabrication.
The course also includes two laboratory experiments:
A) Measurement of the Quantum Hall effect and Shubnikov de Haas oscillations in a two-dimensional electron gas at low temperatures (4 Kelvin).
B) Fabrication (or measurements) of graphene quantum dots.
The experimental results are to be analyzed in context of the theory presented in the course and summarized in reports written in groups of 3-4 students.

预修课程

教材
The course will combine textbook material with recent research reports and reviews. Students are expected to participate actively in this approach, e.g. by engaging in informal classroom discussion.

主要内容
After completing the course the student should to receive the top grade be able to:
• demonstrate understanding of the basic formalism and the key concepts within electron transport
• describe the differences between transport in bulk materials (metals, semiconductors) and nanostructures
• explain the most prominent consequences of quantum effects in electron transport through nanostructures (limited to the contents of the course)
• describe the functionality of selected nanoelectronic devices based on these principles
• differentiate between various regimes of mesoscopic electron transport
• sketch the key elements in realizing an electron transport experiment on a nanostructure
• identify the relevant physical parameters in such an experiment, e.g. the essential length scales, energy scales, characteristic temperatures, quantized units etc
• carry out experiments on simple experimental setups for measurements of nanodevices
• know basic low-temperature techniques for measuring of nanodevices
• apply theory from the course on experimental data to extract relevant parameters
• write a report presenting relevant theory, experimental results and analysis
• differentiate between ideal theoretical quantum phenomena and measurements under less ideal conditions
• present clearly the phenomena reported in a research article within the field of experimental electron transport in nanostructures (in the following referred to as “the article”)
• differentiate between the essential information and technical details in the article
• reproduce and discuss the main features and trends in graphical representations of transport data
• relate the findings to the theory treated in the course
• relate or contrast to relevant examples (e.g. other articles) known from the course in order to demonstrate a broader understanding of the field
• evaluate critically the article’s conclusions to the extent that the background for this discussion has been treated in the course

Explain nanoparticle interaction.
Relate surface physics and chemistry to nanoparticle morphology.
Relate nanoparticle morphology and size to its properties.
Explain the fundamental concepts of the following technologies, and the role and benefits of nanomaterials: Thermoelectrics, Photovoltaics, Magnetic materials, Batteries, Hydrogen storage.
Express the above goals verbally in a scientifically clear, correct and engaging language.

课程编码：167MX005Z 英文名称：Core Technology in Genomics 课时：100 学分：5.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：方向东等

教学目的要求
Biosciences in the post genome era are a technology driven field. Progress depends on investigating molecular changes with large scale technologies. This course aims to build basic understanding of the technologies and methods used to characterize and detect variations in genome, transcriptome, proteome, and metabolites of, humans, animals, plants and microorganisms, and to provide students with knowledge sufficient for evaluating the specific strength, weakness and possibility of individual basic methods for characterizing biological systems at molecular levels. The course will provide the students with the skills to understand explain and select the relevant basic methods for characterizing biological systems by large scale molecular mapping methods. The students will develop the skills to evaluate the strengths and shortcomings of specific technological approaches currently available for describing genome, proteome, transcriptome and metabolome changes in biological systems. The competences achieved are appropriate for preparing the students to design their own experimental approaches for final master projects.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
• Mass spectrometry technology (Instrumentation, Electrospray ionization, Maldi-TOF, ion optics, mass analyzers and operation)
• Practical introduction to Protein id and characterization in Proteomics and Metabolomics. Interpretation of data including post-translational modifications.
• Protein and metabolite quantification (LC-MS/MS, SRM and MRM methods)
• Array technology applied in omics
• Advanced Imaging in omics (EM, MALDI Imaging)
• NMR based metabolomics
• Next generation DNA sequencing
• RNAseq based transcriptomics
• microRNA technology

课程编码：167MX007Z 英文名称：Bioinformatics and Systems Biology 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：王秀杰等

教学目的要求
Enabling students with a basic background in various aspects of Bioinformatics, as well as an introduction to Systems biology. Through case stories utilising a broad range of integrative bioinformatics as well as exposure to analysing data types that are currently topical in life sciences research. The course aim is also to provide the student with a good introduction to the Unix command line and programming techniques that will form the basis for exercises during the coursework.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
The advent of Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) technologies have transformed how biological research is being performed and today almost all biological fields use the technology for cutting edge discoveries. Today, a human genome can today be sequenced in very short time for approximately $1000 giving unprecedented possibilities for investigating human traits, evolution and diseases. Similarly whole bacterial communities and their interplay with the environment can be studied, unravelling novel enzymes and organisms. As these experiments produce massive amounts of data bioinformatics skills and supercomputing is crucial for the analysis. The aim of the course is to give the students a good basic handling of the Unix command line for handling large data sets, knowledge of the NGS technology and steps for sequence data analysis as well as a background to Bioinformatics
in general and an introduction to systems biology.

This course provides an introduction to elementary Unix, basic programming principles and good programming practices. The Unix introduction covers basic commands, file manipulation and input/output redirection. The idea is to equip the student for handling common bioinformatic file formats and forming a good basis for the computer exercises which are integrated with the lectures.

The student will get an introduction to the most commonly used bioinformatics databases, such as Genbank, PDB, UniProt and SwissProt and work with bioinformatic algorithms such as BLAST, PSI-BLAST and pairwise- and multiple alignment. Weight-matrix based methods will be introduced and how to search using weight-matrices. An introduction to broader topics such as network biology, metagenomics and cancer informatics will also feature on the course to provide a vision for the breadth of Omics data and how their utilisation leads to translational impact.

课程编码：167MX008Z 英文名称：Biostatics and Experimental Design 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：钱文峰

教学目的要求
Sophisticated statistical methods for analyzing omics data are increasingly employed to deal with the complex data sets from the high-thoughput experiments. With statistical tools, scientists generate testable hypotheses and draw the scientific conclusions supported by data. This course aims to build basic understanding of the theoretical and practical aspects of various biostatistical concepts and analytical methods commonly used in the omics filed. It focuses on the concepts of experimental design, qualitative and quantitative analysis of data, and statistical inferences. The course also aims to provide the students with knowledge sufficient for evaluating the specific strength, weakness and possibility of individual statistical methods as well as the capability to critically read articles on the subject. In addition, this course will provide a hands-on tutorial on anlyzing data with R, the most important statistical tool in academy.

预修课程

教材
Robert R. Sokal and F. James Rohlf.(2011) Biometry (ISBN: 9780716786047)

主要内容
1. Descriptive statistics
2. Introduction to probability
3. Introduction to hypothesis testing (for two groups of numbers)
4. Introduction to multiple hypothesis testing
5. Introduction to analysis of variance (ANOVA)
6. 2 by 2 contingency table
7. Linear regression
8. Correlation
9. Principal component analysis (PCA) and cluster analysis
10. Statistical power
11. Data transformation
12. Data visualization

课程编码：167MX009Z 英文名称：Food Omics 课时：40 学分：2.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：吴琳

教学目的要求
The “omics” disciplines are strongly in demand in the sectors of food, agriculture, biotechnology and applied microbiology. In these areas “omics” represent a largely underexploited potential of technologies with great promise to advance developments to gain insights at the molecular level into e.g. quality of foods, feed and raw materials, nutritional values, probiotics, crop plant breeding, processes in food production, biotechnology and fermentation and food ingredients. The use of “omics” techniques is rapidly implemented in these fields of fundamental and applied research with anticipated huge benefits involving also development of dedicated emerging “omics” tools.
The course aims to provide a broad knowledge of the use of “omics” in food science concerned with cereals, vegetables, probiotic bacteria, livestock, meat and dairy products. It will provide background into the technical sub-disciplines of proteomics with reported application in the various areas of food and agricultural sciences. It focuses on the experimental design from sample preparation to qualitative and quantitative analysis of data. Case stories will be selected to cover various thematics including also functional properties of key proteins involved e.g. i) uptake and metabolism of prebiotic oligosaccharides by probiotic bacteria from the human gut, ii) redox control systems in cereals and microbes in relation to food biotechnology, iii) quality of selected foods. The course also aims to provide the students with knowledge sufficient for proposing research strategies to address objectives to be pursued in the areas of food and agricultural sciences and to evaluate the specific strength, weakness and possibility of individual experimental plans and projects as well as the competence to critically read articles on the subject.

预修课程

教材

主要内容
1. Lectures on relevant techniques in proteomics
2. Introduction to the area of food and agricultural sciences
3. Description of case stories on “omics” in probiotics bacteria
4. Description of case stories “omics” in crop cereals for functional properties and quality
5. Description of case stories “omics” in livestock, vegetables, other raw materials
6. Description of case stories “omics” redox-active processes in lactic acid bacteria and cereal crops
7. The discovery chain from “2D spots to 3D structures” and ”omics”-based identification of key proteins
8. Production using recombinant techniques and characterization of key proteins in cereals and probiotics
9. PULs gene clusters (PULs = polysaccharide utilization loci) in probiotic bacteria, “omics” and phylogenetic analysis
10. Future perspectives

课程编码：167MX010Z 英文名称：Personalized Track 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：一级学科核心课 主讲教师：-

教学目的要求
The main objective of this part of the Omics education is to provide the individual student with needed basic knowledge required to select a theme for the master thesis, and moreover provide a contact that can serve as a ”help-desk” throughout the whole study, although with main emphasis on the final Master’s thesis. Thus, this course will be the glue of the entire study programme. The objective is to introduce a range of applications of Omics and presentation of various relevant areas of research, which will help the student in selecting his/her personal “biological” question that will follow the student through the study programme and form the basis for the Master thesis. Skills acquired in the technical, analytical, biological and bioinformatics focussed courses, as well as “Entrepeneurship” will be applied to the personal “biological” question selected.
Moreover, the student will learn about project management , scientific writing and oral presentation of a scientific topic to peers and to non-experts. Standards in publication ethics and scientific conduct will be discussed. Scientific standards that are expected by peer-reviewed journals will be presented.

Suggested topics for biological areas:
1. Omics in medical applications (e.g. metabolic-, degenerative-, and cancer diseases)
2. Omics and microbiology
3. Omics and plant biology
4. Omics and agriculture (e.g. animal breeding, food and soil).

课程编码：B01GB003Y-A01 英文名称：Linear Algebra II-A 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：席南华

教学目的要求
本课程是各专业本科生必修基础课。要求学生通过本门课程的学习，掌握线性代数的基础知识和方法。
通过本课程教学，学生应达到以下基本要求：掌握线性代数的基础知识和方法，了解和形成线性代数的思维方式，为学习进一步的基础数学课程和应用数学课程打下基础，并具备运用线性代数的知识和方法解决一些来自不同背景的问题的基础能力。

预修课程
线性代数I

主要内容
一、空间与形式（约三周）
 抽象向量空间、维数与基底 约三节课
 对偶空间 约二节课
 双线性型和二次型 约五节课

二、线性算子 （约三周）
 向量空间的线性映射、算子代数 约三节课
 不变子空间与特征向量 约三节课
 若尔当标准型 约六节课

三、带有纯量乘积的向量空间（约四周）
 欧几里得向量空间 约二节课
 埃尔米特向量空间 约二节课
 带有纯量乘积的空间上的线性算子 约四节课
 复化与实化 约二节课
 正交多项式 约四节课

四、仿射空间与欧几里得空间（约三周）
 仿射空间、欧几里得空间 约四节课
 群与几何 约四节课
 带有指数有限度量的空间 约二节课

五、 二次曲面 (约三周)
 二次函数 约二节课
 仿射空间与欧几里得空间中的二次曲面 约四节课
 射影空间及其中的二次曲面 约五节课

六、 张量 (约二周)
 张量计算初步 约二节课
 张量的卷积，对称化与交错化 约三节课
 外代数 约三节课

微积分II-A

课程编码：B01GB004Y-A01 英文名称：Calculus II-A 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：张平

教学目的要求
本课程是各专业本科生必修基础课。要求学生通过本门课程的学习，掌握微积分的入门知识和方法，还有相关的微积分基本知识。本课程A（数理）类，以严格的理论证明为基础，适合那些以后继续学习数学、物理、计算机等学科的学生，也适合继续学习其他学科的学生。通过本课程教学，学生应达到以下基本要求：掌握多元微积分基本知识及相关的微积分知识的基本概念和基本方法，初步了解和形成微积分的思维方式，为学习微积分III和其他课程打下基础。

预修课程
微积分I

主要内容
第九章 多元函数的极限与连续
1 n维空间及其性质
2 多元函数的极限
3 多元函数的连续性
第十章 多元函数微分学
1 多元函数的微分
2 微分法的基本定律
3 多元可微函数的性质
第十一章 隐函数定理及其应用
1 隐函数
2 隐函数组
3 几何应用
4 条件极值
第十二章 多重积分
1 n维区间上的黎曼积分
2 集合上的积分
3 积分的一般性质
4 化重积分为累次积分
5 重积分的变量替换
6 反常重积分
第十三章 n 维实空间中的曲面以及微分形式
1 n 维实空间中的曲面
2 曲面的定向
3 曲面的边界其及定向
4 欧式空间内曲面的面积
5 微分形式初步
第十四章 曲线积分与曲面积分
1 微分形式的积分
2 体积形式
3 第一型积分
4 第二型积分
5 分析中的积分公式

课时分配

课程思政

教材
B．A．卓里奇著，《数学分析》， 高等教育出版社， 2005年

参考文献
华东师范大学数学系. 《数学分析》(第四版). 高等教育出版社. 2010年
R. 柯朗，F. 约翰， 《微积分和数学分析引论》.（张鸿林、周民强译）， 科学出版社， 2001年
W. Rudin, 《数学分析原理》.(赵慈庚、蒋铎译)， 机械工业出版社. 2012年

拓扑基础

课程编码：B0111003Y 英文名称：Basic Topology 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：专业必修课 主讲教师：段海豹

教学目的要求
基础拓扑学是数学专业本科生的专业必修课。 同时也可作为物理学、力学等专业本科生的选修课。课程的主要内容包括：
1）点集拓扑； 2）组合拓扑； 3）代数拓扑。
考虑到拓扑学是几何学的一个分支，教学中应注重培养学生的几何想象力， 以及对于几何问题的整体分析的能力。 尤其是， 在讲解拓扑学一般性理论的同时， 介绍拓扑空间的基本表现形式，以及研究方法。 为学生们后续课程的学习打下基础。

预修课程
抽象代数（或代数学中的群论）

主要内容
第1章．引论
1.1. Euler定理；
1.2. 拓扑等价；
1.3. 曲面；
1.4. 抽象空间；
1.5.一个分类定理；
1.6. 拓扑不变量。
第2章．拓扑空间及连续映射
2.1. 开集与闭集；
2.2. 连续映射；
2.3. 充满空间的曲线；
2.4 . Tietze扩张定理。
第3章．拓扑空间的紧致性与连通性
3.1．欧氏空间的有界闭集；
3.2. Heine Borel定理；
3.3．紧致空间;
3.4．乘积空间;
3.5. 连通性道路连通性.
第4章. 粘合空间
4.1. Mbius带的制作;
4.2. 粘合拓扑;
4.3. 拓扑群;
4.4. 轨道空间
第5章. 拓扑空间的基本群
5.1. 同伦映射;
5.2. 拓扑空间的基本群;
5.3. 计算;
5.4. 同伦型;
5.5. Brouwer不动点定理;
5.6. 平面的分离;
5.7. 曲面的边界;
5.8. 复叠空间及其基本性质
第6章. 单纯剖分
6.1. 空间的单纯剖分;
6.2. 重心重分;
6.3. 单纯逼近;
6.4. 复形的棱道群;
6.5. 轨道空间的单纯剖分
第7章. 曲面
7.1分类;
7.2. 单纯剖分与定向;
7.3. Euler示性数;
7.4．剜补运算;
7.5. 曲面符号.
第8章. 单纯同调
8.1．闭链与边缘;
8.2．同调群;
8.3．例子;
8.4. 单纯映射;
8.5. 辐式重分;
8.6．不变性.
第9章. 映射度与Lefschetz数
9.1. 球面的连续映射;
9.2. Euler Poincaré公式;
9.3. Borsuk Ulam定理;
9.4. Lefschetz不动点定理.

实分析

课程编码：B0111004Y 英文名称：Real Analysis 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：专业必修课 主讲教师：张志涛

教学目的要求
本课程为中国科学院大学本科生的数学与应用数学专业必修课。 本课程主要讨论抽象积分理论(勒贝格积分等)、测度、空间理论、微分、乘积空间的积分等。通过本课程的学习，要求学生掌握实分析的基本概念、方法、技巧和一些重要定理结果，为进一步学习现代数学和从事数学研究工作打下坚实的基础。

预修课程
数学分析

主要内容
第一章 抽象积分. 可测函数、简单函数及可积函数的基本概念，测度的基本性质，函数列的收敛性，勒贝格单调收敛定理，Fatou引理，控制收敛定理。12学时，教学重点：可积函数列及收敛性，Fatou引理；难点：控制收敛定理。

第二章 正博雷尔（Borel）测度. 拓扑中的基本概念，Riesz表示定理，Borel 测度的正则性，Lebesgue 测度，可测函数的连续性，Lusin（鲁金） 定理。14学时，教学重点：Riesz表示定理；Lusin定理；难点：Riesz表示定理，Borel 测度的正则性。

第三章 空间. 凸函数，Jensen（詹森） 不等式， 空间中的重要不等式：如Holder 不等式，Minkowski 不等式， 函数列中的范数收敛与依测度收敛以及几乎处处收敛之间的关系。6学时，教学重点：Jensen 不等式，Holder不等式，Minkowski不等式；难点：各种收敛之间的关系。

第四章 Hilbert空间的初等理论. 内积，平行四边形法则，投影定理，正交基，傅立叶级数。8学时，教学重点：投影定理，正交基；难点：傅立叶级数。

第五章 Banach空间技巧的例子. 赋范空间，贝尔定理及其推论， Hahn-Banach定理，Poisson 积分。10学时，教学重点：Hahn-Banach 定理；难点：贝尔定理及其推论。

第六章 复测度. 全变差，绝对连续性，Radon-Nikodym(拉东-尼柯迪姆) 定理极其推论, 空间上的有界线性泛函。12学时，教学重点：Radon-Nikodym 导数， 空间上的有界线性泛函；难点：Radon-Nikodym 定理极其推论。

第七章 微分. 测度的导数，Hardy-Littlewood 极大函数，微积分基本定理，可微变换。8学时，教学重点：测度的导数，微积分基本定理；难点：Hardy-Littlewood 极大函数。

第八章 乘积空间的积分. 乘积空间的测度，Fubini定理，乘积测度的完备化，卷积，分布函数。 6学时，教学重点：Fubini定理；难点：卷积，分布函数。

课时分配

课程思政

教材
Walter Rudin，Real and Complex Analysis，《实分析与复分析》，第三版,2006.

参考文献
周民强，《实变函数论》，第二版，北京大学出版社，2008。

课程教师信息
张志涛，研究员，博士生导师，国家杰出青年基金获得者，科技部中青年科技创新领军人才，德国洪堡学者。研究非线性泛函分析理论和对偏微分方程的应用，出版Springer专著一部《Variational, Topological, and Partial Order Methods with Their Applications》，在 Journal of Functional Analysis，Annales de l’Institut Henri Poincare Analyse Non Lineaire，J. Differential Equations，Calculus of Variations and PDE, Transactions of the American Mathematical Society等国际著名学术刊物发表论文60多篇，解决了困难的Terracini公开问题和猜想等，获得一些重要成果，这些成果被国内外数学家大量引用。担任Boundary Value Problems (SCI，Springer)等4个国际刊物编委，指导博士后、博士生毕业多人，曾获中科院“优秀研究生指导教师奖”。

概率论

课程编码：B0111005Y 英文名称：Probability 课时：80 学分：4.00 课程属性：专业必修课 主讲教师：巩馥洲

教学目的要求
本课程是继微积分、线性代数之后的一门必修基础课，是研究现实世界中大量存在的各种随机现象统计规律性的一门数学课程。通过本课程的学习，使学生掌握概率论的基本知识和基本运算技能，同时培养和训练学生在运用随机数学方法分析和解决问题的能力，为学习数理统计和随机过程等有关专业课程和进一步扩大现代数学知识提供必要的数学基础。

预修课程
微积分，线性代数，复分析

主要内容
一 随机事件与概率
1. 随机现象与统计规律性
2. 样本空间，随机事件及其运算
3. 古典概率，几何概率
4. 概率空间，概率的公理化结构
二 条件概率与事件的独立性
1. 条件概率与乘法公式
2. 全概率公式，Bayes公式
3. 事件的独立性
4. 独立重复试验，Bernoulli试验
三 随机变量及其分布
1. 随机变量及其分布（离散型，连续型）
2. 多维随机变量及其分布（离散型，连续型）
3. 条件分布与随机变量的独立性
4. 随机变量的函数及其分布
四 随机变量的数字特征
1. 数学期望与方差，矩
2. 协方差与相关系数
3. 熵与信息量
4. 条件期望与最优预测
5. 母函数，Laplace变换, 矩母函数，特征函数
五 极限定理
1. 随机变量的收敛性
2. 弱大数定律，强大数定律
3. 中心极限定理
六 随机过程初步
1. 随机过程及其有限维分布族
2. 独立增量过程, 平稳增量过程，二阶矩过程，正交增量过程
3. Gauss过程, Brown运动，Poisson过程
4. 离散时间Markov链初步
5. 平稳过程及其遍历论初步
七 随机模拟
1. Monte Carlo方法与随机数的产生
2. 随机变量的模拟(离散型，连续型)
3. Markov链的模拟
4. 积分的近似计算

热学

课程编码：B02GB002Y-05 英文名称：Thermal Physics 课时：72 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：杨义峰

教学目的要求
（略）

预修课程
（略）

主要内容
第一章： 平衡态与状态方程
1. 状态参量与平衡态：热力学系统；状态参量；平衡态；
2. 温度：温度的概念；热力学第零定律；温标；
3. 状态方程：经验体系；理想气体状态方程；范德瓦耳斯方程；
4. 理想气体的微观图像：物质的微观结构；理想气体的微观模型；理想气体的压强公式；温度的统计意义和微观解释；理想气体的传热过程。

第二章： 热力学第一定律
1. 热力学第一定律：能量守恒定律；力学作用下的能量转移-功；热学作用下的能量转移-热量；热力学系统内部的能量-内能；热力学第一定律；
2. 热力学第一定律的应用：准静态过程；热容；内能和焓；热力学第一定律对理想气体的应用：理想气体的热容；热学过程；
3. 循环过程与卡诺循环：循环过程；理想气体的卡诺循环及其效率；
4. 熵函数及第一定律的微观图像：第一定律的状态函数表示；熵函数的引入；第一定律的微观解释。

第三章： 热力学第二定律
1. 热力学第二定律的表述与卡诺定理：热力学第二定律的表述；热力学第二定律的数学表述；卡诺定律应用举例；
2. 熵及熵定理：熵的概念；熵的计算；熵增加原理；
3. 熵及热力学第二定律的统计解释：玻尔兹曼熵；热力学第二定律得统计意义；熵定律是统计规律；
4. 自由能、自由焓及热力学方程：亥姆霍兹自由能，最大功原理；吉布斯函数，自由焓；热力学系统态函数及其关系；
5. 热力学第三定律：热力学温标；热力学温标与实际温标的关系；熵的标准参考点；热力学第三定律。

期中考试

第四章： 平衡态系统的统计规律
1. 无序系统：随机运动的统计规律；布朗运动的简单分析；
2. 概率论简介（如果概率论已经讲了可以不讲）；
3. 麦克斯韦速度分布与速率分布：麦克斯韦速度分布；麦克斯韦速率分布；速度分布与速率分布的应用；
4. 近独立子系统的最概然分布：基本概念；等概率原理；最概然分布（麦克斯韦-玻尔兹曼分布）；从M-B分布到麦克斯韦速度分布；
5. 玻尔兹曼分布的一般形式：重力场中粒子按高度的等温分布率；玻尔兹曼密度分布率；麦克斯韦-玻尔兹曼分布率；
6. 能量均分原理与热容量：分子的自由度；能量均分定理；准理想气体的内能与热容；
7. 量子气体简介。

第五章： 近平衡态中的输运过程
1. 气体的碰撞频率与平均自由程：有效碰撞界面与碰撞速度；平均碰撞频率与平均自由程；气体分子的自由程分布；
2. 输运现象的宏观规律：基本概念；粘滞现象的宏观规律；扩散现象的宏观规律；热量传递的宏观规律；
3. 气体中输运现象的微观解释：基本假设；输运过程中的流；输运稀疏的推导；稀薄气体的输运现象。

第六章： 单元系统的复相平衡与相变
1. 相、相变、相平衡的概念：平衡态稳定条件；相平衡；相率；相变的概念；
2. 单元系的复相平衡：平衡条件；克拉伯龙方程；汽液相变；范德瓦耳斯等温线；亚稳态；
3. 液-气相变：液-气相变的形式；失稳分解与成核长大；亚稳态；沸腾与凝结。

杨义峰，中国科学院物理研究所研究员，博士生导师。1997年入学北京大学物理系并获得学士和硕士学位，2003年至2007年在德国马普固态研究所学习并获斯图加特大学博士学位，随后于美国加州大学Davis分校物理系和Los Alamos国家实验室读博士后，2010年底回物理所工作，2013年获选物理所“科技新人奖”，2015年受聘中国科学院大学岗位教授，同年获得基金委优秀青年科学基金。主要方向为强关联电子现象的理论和数值研究，已发表SCI论文30余篇，包括Nature 1篇，Nature子刊2篇，PNAS 5篇，PRL 5篇等。

5. 玻尔兹曼分布的一般形式：重力场中粒子按高度的等温分布率；玻尔兹曼密度分布率；麦克斯韦-玻尔兹曼分布率；
6. 能量均分原理与热容量：分子的自由度；能量均分定理；准理想气体的内能与热容；
7. 量子气体简介。

第三章： 近平衡态中的输运过程
1. 气体的碰撞频率与平均自由程：有效碰撞界面与碰撞速度；平均碰撞频率与平均自由程；气体分子的自由程分布；
2. 输运现象的宏观规律：基本概念；粘滞现象的宏观规律；扩散现象的宏观规律；热量传递的宏观规律；
3. 气体中输运现象的微观解释：基本假设；输运过程中的流；输运稀疏的推导；稀薄气体的输运现象。

期中考试

第四章： 热力学第一定律
1. 热力学第一定律：能量守恒定律；力学作用下的能量转移-功；热学作用下的能量转移-热量；热力学系统内部的能量-内能；热力学第一定律；
2. 热力学第一定律的应用：准静态过程；热容；内能和焓；热力学第一定律对理想气体的应用：理想气体的热容；热学过程；
3. 循环过程与卡诺循环：循环过程；理想气体的卡诺循环及其效率；
4. 熵函数及第一定律的微观图像：第一定律的状态函数表示；熵函数的引入；第一定律的微观解释。

第五章： 热力学第二定律
1. 热力学第二定律的表述与卡诺定理：热力学第二定律的表述；热力学第二定律的数学表述；卡诺定律应用举例；
2. 熵及熵定理：熵的概念；熵的计算；熵增加原理；
3. 熵及热力学第二定律的统计解释：玻尔兹曼熵；热力学第二定律得统计意义；熵定律是统计规律；
4. 自由能、自由焓及热力学方程：亥姆霍兹自由能，最大功原理；吉布斯函数，自由焓；热力学系统态函数及其关系；
5. 热力学第三定律：热力学温标；热力学温标与实际温标的关系；熵的标准参考点；热力学第三定律。

第六章： 液体
1. 液体的彻体性质：从气体理论逼近；从固体理论逼近；景象函数分析法；
2. 液体的表面性质：表面张力与表面能；表面张力系数与温度的关系；拉普拉斯公式；
3. 表面接触角，毛细现象。

第七章： 单元系统的复相平衡与相变
1. 相、相变、相平衡的概念：平衡态稳定条件；相平衡；相率；相变的概念；
2. 单元系的复相平衡：平衡条件；克拉伯龙方程；汽液相变；范德瓦耳斯等温线；亚稳态；
3. 液-气相变：液-气相变的形式；失稳分解与成核长大；亚稳态；沸腾与凝结。

课程教师信息
李骥，男，1970年生，博士学历。目前是中国科学院大学工学院教授。曾经在境外高水平大学进行了约7年的研究工作。回国后，李骥在国科大创建了工程热物理教学实验室，该实验室每年为近百名热物理方向的研究生提供教学实验及研究。李骥在本学科领域发表各类期刊论文约60余篇，其中以第一作者身份发表SCI论文约30篇，他人引用超过500次。同时获得授权专利几十项（包括美国专利5项）。 李骥的研究兴趣主要围绕先进热管理技术，从事热能的输运、储存及热功转化方向的研究。

其它说明

电磁学

课程编码：B02GB003Y-05 英文名称：Electromagnetics 课时：72 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：孙刚

教学目的要求
帮助学生系统掌握电磁运动的基本现象、基本概念和基本规律，学会分析和解决电磁学的基本问题。通过讨论电磁学理论的建立过程，了解物理学研究的基本范式。
教学内容的安排将足够引起好学生的深入思考，同时让中等成绩的学生能够听懂。授课时在阐述电磁学原理的同时，简明再现电磁学从诞生到现在的发展历程，讨论电磁现象中的物理原理和深层哲学思想。通过对电磁现象的讨论，不仅使学生打好电磁学的基础，而且使学生对物理现象的本质和普遍性有深一层的理解，帮助学生适应从中学到大学的转变，启发学生的独立创新思考，使学生打好基础并为今后的发展做准备。

其它说明

原子物理学

课程编码：B02GB005Y-04 英文名称：Atomic Physics 课时：72 学分：4.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：吕才典

教学目的要求
原子物理学是一门讨论物质基本结构和相互作用的导论课程。本课程以阐述原子结构为核心，讨论原子和原子核这一物质结构层次的基本物理图像。要求学生了解在原子研究领域中经典物理遇到的主要困难，为此而引入的一些全新的分析方法和推理思路。并要求学生掌握原子的基本结构、原子的能级和光谱的基本规律、原子的一些基本概念（包括：原子的量子态、电子自旋、泡利原理等等）以及原子核的性质和核反应的基本规律。为量子力学的学习打下基础。

预修课程
高等数学、力学、热学、电磁学

主要内容
第一章 原子的核式模型
原子的发现；电子和原子核的发现；卢瑟福模型和卢瑟福散射；原子行星模型的意义和困难。

第二章 波尔的氢原子理论
氢原子光谱；夫兰克-赫兹实验；波尔的氢原子理论；波尔理论的成功和局限；

第三章 量子力学初步
能量的量子化；光子的引入与光电效应；物质波和波粒二相性；薛定谔方程、几率波及海森堡不确定原理；氢原子光谱的量子力学解释。

第四章 原子中电子的自旋
电子轨道运动的磁矩；史特恩－盖拉赫实验；电子的自旋假设；原子光谱的精细结构：碱金属双线；赛曼效应、斯塔克效应。

第五章 多电子原子
氦原子的光谱和能级；两个电子的耦合；泡利不相容原理；元素周期表。

第六章 X射线和激光
X射线的原子起源和应用；康普顿散射；原子的激发和退激：荧光和激光产生机制；

第七章 原子核物理初步
原子核的辐射（?，?，?射线）；辐射探测；原子核的结构；核反应：裂变与聚变；原子核物理应用。

第八章 基本粒子物理简介
强子与轻子；介子与重子；夸克；四种基本相互作用；物质与反物质；粒子加速器与探测器。


课时分配
本课程共72个学时，其中课堂讲授方式60个学时。根据授课具体情况，将安排12学时的习题课。

课程考核
平时成绩（作业、小测验、出勤）占30%；期中考试占20%；期末闭卷笔试，占总成绩的50%

课程教师信息
吕才典， 山东省莱阳市人。 1989 年毕业于北京大学物理系。1994 年获北京大学物理系理论物理专业博士学位。随后在中科院理论物理研究所、以色列理工大学、德国汉堡大学、日本广岛大学作博士后等研究工作。现任中国科学院高能物理研究所研究员，博士生导师，理论物理研究室副主任，高能物理前沿研究中心副主任，国际专业期刊The European Physical Journal C编委。主要从事粒子物理唯象学方面的研究工作，发表SCI论文130多篇，被引用总数超过4000次，其中有7篇论文单篇被引用超过100次。2006年获得国家基金委“杰出青年基金”；2015年度国家基金委创新研究群体学术带头人。2010年所授的“粒子物理I”研究生课程获国科大“校级优秀奖”，2011年获中国科学院“朱李月华优秀教师”奖，2012-2017国际理论物理中心(ICTP)资深协联成员。

原子物理学

课程编码：B02GB005Y-02 英文名称：Atomic Physics 课时：60 学分：3.00 课程属性：公共必修课 主讲教师：李海波

教学目的要求
原子物理学是一门讨论物质基本结构和相互作用的导论课程。通过本课程的学习，使学生能够熟练掌握原子物理学、原子核物理学和基本粒子物理学的基本原理、基本概念和基本规律，掌握原子和原子核的结构、运动规律和研究方法，培养学生分析问题和解决问题的能力，并为以后继续学习量子力学、固体物理学、近代物理实验等课程打下坚实的基础。结合一些物理学史的介绍，使学生了解如何由分析物理实验结果出发、建立物理模型，进而建立物理理论体系的过程，了解微观物理学对现代科学技术重大影响和各种应用，了解并适当涉及正在发展的学科前沿，扩大视野，引导学生勇于思考、乐于探索发现，培养其良好的科学素质。

预修课程
高等数学、力学、热学、电磁学

主要内容
第一章 原子的核式模型
原子的基本概念；电子的发现；卢瑟福模型和卢瑟福散射；原子的实验发现；原子行星模型的意义和困难。

第二章 波尔的氢原子理论
氢原子光谱；夫兰克-赫兹实验；波尔的氢原子理论；波尔理论的成功和局限；

第三章 量子力学初步
黑体辐射；光电效应；能量的量子化；物质波和波粒二相性；薛定谔方程、几率波及海森堡不确定原理；氢原子光谱的量子力学解释。

第四章 原子中电子的自旋
电子轨道运动的磁矩；史特恩－盖拉赫实验；电子的自旋假设；原子光谱的精细结构：碱金属双线；赛曼效应、斯塔克效应。

第五章 多电子原子
氦原子的光谱和能级；两个电子的耦合；泡利不相容原理；元素周期表。

第六章 X射线和激光
X射线的原子起源和应用；康普顿散射；原子的激发和退激：荧光和激光产生机制；

第七章 原子核物理初步
原子核的辐射（?，?，?射线）；辐射探测；原子核的结构；核反应：裂变与聚变；原子核物理应用。

第八章 基本粒子物理简介
核子结构；夸克模型；强子谱学；四种相互作用；重味物理；CP破坏。


课程考核
平时成绩（作业、小测验、出勤）占25%；期中笔试占25%；期末笔试占总成绩的50%

本课程共60个学时，主要为课堂讲授方式。此外根据授课具体情况，将额外安排10-20学时的习题课。

课程教师信息
李海波，高能物理所研究员，主要从事BES实验。先后担任BESIII国际合作组物理协调人、文章发表委员会主席等职，负责BESIII物理分析工作。利用BESII和BESIII实验数据开展稀有衰变过程的寻找、轻介子和粲介子衰变性质的实验研究等。2011年参加日本COMET国际合作实验，寻找缪轻子到电子的转换过程，现担任COMET实验中方负责人、实验技术设计报告编委等职。COMET实验将对 mu + Al --> electron + Al 转换过程进行测量，其单事例敏感度比现有实验提高一万倍，是目前低能量前沿寻找超出标准模型新物理的黄金过程。获得2011年国家自然科学基金委“杰出青年基金”资助。 2017年起担任《Chinese Physics C》副主编。
